Boththecovalenttetrahedral cagescomprisewithmultiplemetalbindingdi-iminemoietiesandlarge3Dconfinedcavity.TheorganiccageTC-Rwasfurtheremployed asasupportmaterialforthepreparation ofultrafinePdNPs(~3.5nm).Moreover, thecomposite [Pd(0)@TC-R-A] demon-stratedtobeanefficientheterogeneous catalystforselectivehomocoupling reactionofarylandhetero-aryl halidesforseveralcyclesofuse.

Theresultingmixturewasallowedtoreactfor2hoursatroomtemperature leadingtocolourchangefromcolourless todeepyellow(FigureS22).Thisobservation issolelyduetothePd(II)@TC-R complexationwhichwasfurtherconfirmed byFT-IR,UV-VisandXPSanalysis(FiguresS22¨CS28). Next,excessamountofNaBH4(22mg,0.57mmol)withmethanol wasaddedintothisreactionmixturewhichwassufficient toreducebothPd(II)metalsandalltheiminebondsoftheorganiccageTC-R.Theresultantsolutionproduced blackprecipitate after1hstirring.ThecompositematerialPd(0)@TC-R-A (Cage-PdNPs hybrid)wascollectedandwashedwithmethanol anddriedovernight. Unfortunately, theresultedblacksolidwasinsolubleinmostofthesolventswhichrestricted ustocharacterize itbysolutionphaseNMRandESI-MSanalysis.However, thetransformation ofiminelinkagestoreducedaminebondswasexamined bymonitoring solid-stateFT-IRplotofPd(0)@TC-R-A whereiminepeak(CEN)oftheparentcageTC-Rat1642cm1completely disappeared (Fig-ureS26).Also,severalliteratures alreadyreported thattheadditionofmethanolic NaBH4intosimilarkindsofreactionmixturepreceded toreduceboththemetalionsaswellasiminelinkagesoforganiccage.[10c,11d,f]As-synthesized PdNPs(Pd(0)@TC-R-A) werecharacterizedbyseveralspectroscopic techniques suchasUV-Vis,SEM,TEM,FT-IR,XPSandICP-MSanalysis(FiguresS22¨CS28). 43wt%palladium loadingwasassessedbyinductive coupledplasmonmassspectrometry (ICP-MS)analysiswhichisquitehighbyusingwetchemicalapproach.[20a]Transmission electronmicro-scopy(TEM)imagesexhibited thehomogeneously dispersedPdNPs(Pd(0)@TC-R-A) withaverageparticlessizeof3.5?0.3nm(Figure5).Considering thetheoretical estimate forintrinsiccavitydiameter (~1.34nm)fromtheDFToptimizedstructure(TC-R),theobserved PdNPs(3.5?0.3nm)werelargerinsize(FigureS20).So,itcanbecertainlyassumed thatthenucleation ofthePdNPswascommenced ateachvertexsitesoftetrahedral cageTC-R.Subsequently, asthereduction proceedsfurther,thetinyPdNPswereanchored intheinter-cages spaceandwereprotected bythesurrounding aromatic walls(Fig-ureS21).Also,theenergydispersive X-ray(EDX)mappingimages(FigureS24)weresnapped duringSEMexperimentwhichdisplayed thepresence ofPdatomsalongwithcageelements(CandN).

Experimental SectionSynthesis ofTC-RInaround-bottom flask,thealdehyde HA(32mg,0.0499mmol)wasdissolvedin100mLCHCl3.10mLmethanol solutionof(1R,2R)-diaminocyclohexane (CA-R;17.07mg,0.1497mmol)wasaddeddropwise withstirringtotheabovesolution.Theresultingmixturewasstirredatroomtemperature (298K)forthreedays.Then,solventwasconcentrated andn-pentane wasaddedtoobtainsolidproduct.Theyellowish-white product(TC-R)waswashedseveraltimeswithmethanol. IsolatedYield:~91.5%(40mg,0.0114mmol).

Synthesis ofPd(0)@TC-R-A Catalyst20mg(0.0057mmol,1eqv)ofTC-Rwasdissolved chloroform(8mL).A6mLsolutionofPd(OAc)2(32mg,0.143mmol,25eqv)inchloroform wasalsoprepared andaddedslowlytothecagesolution.Themixturewasstirredfor2hatroomtemperature toresultayellowsolution. 10mLMeOHand22mgNaBH4(0.57mmol)wereaddedportionwisetotheabovesolution.Thereactionmixtureturnedblack.Afterfurther1hstirring,theblacksolidwascollected bycentrifugation. Subsequently, theresultingsolidwaswashedwithMeOHseveraltoisolatePd(0)@TC-R-A afterovernight dryinginvacuum.

GeneralProcedure forHomocoupling Reaction ofHaloarenesTypicalmethodforthehomocoupling reaction of4-bromoani-soleusingPd(0)@TC-R-A: In25mLRBflask,37.4mg(0.2mmol)of4-bromoanisole, 45mg(0.4mmol)ofK-tert-butoxide, and4mg(8mol%)ofPd(0)@TC-R-A weretakenin2mLDMF-water mixture(3:1,v/v).Theresulting mixturewasdegassed underinertatmosphere andstirredfor18hat110¡ãC(oilbath).Aftercompletion ofreaction,solidcatalystwasremovedbyfiltration.Thecatalystwaswashedwithwater/EtOAc anddriedinvacuumfornextcycleofuse.Thenthefiltratewasextracted withEtOAc(20mL¡Á3).Organicpartwaswashedwithwateranddriedoveranhydrous Na2SO4followedbycomplete removalofsolvent.Theresultingcrudemasswasanalyzedby1HNMRtocalculateproductconversion. Moreover, thecrudeproductwasfurtherpurifiedbycolumnchromatography (silicagel-100mesh)toobtainisolatedyield.

(yellowamorphous solid),NMRyield99%,isolatedyield~82%(13mg);1HNMR(400MHz,CDCl3):¦Ä9.30(s,2H,ArH),8.98(s,4H,ArH).13C{1H}NMR(100MHz,CDCl3):¦Ä159.0(ArC),154.9(ArC),128.5(ArC).The1Hand13C{1H}NMRdataofthiscompound matchedwithpreviousreport.[20b]LargescalecatalysisusingsamemodelreactionUsingidenticalcatalyticmethodandreactionconditions, alarge-scalecatalysis hasbeencarriedout.187mg(1mmol)of4-bromoanisole, 225mg(2mmol)ofK-tert-butoxide, and20mg(8mol%Pdwithrespecttosubstrate) ofPd(0)@TC-R-A weretakeninDMF-water mixture.Theresultingmixturewasdegassed underinertatmosphere andstirredfor18hat110¡ãC(oilbath).Aftercompletation ofthereaction,crudeproductwasextracted andcheckedfortheproductconversion by1HNMRanalysis.Further-more,thecrudeproductwaspurifiedbysilicagelcolumnchromatography. NMRyield99%,isolatedyield~92%(98.4mg).

Synthesis of Pd(0)@TC -R-A Catalyst : 20 mg (0.0057 mmol, 1 eqv) of TC-R was dissolved chloroform (8 mL). A  6 mL solution of Pd(OAc) 2 (32 mg, 0.143 mmol, 25 eqv) in chloroform was also prepared and added slowly to the cage solution. The mixture was stirred for 2 h at room temperature to result a yellow solution. 10 mL MeOH and 22 mg NaBH 4 (0.57 mmol) were added portion wise to the above  solution. The reaction mixture turned black. After further 1 h stirring,   S3  the black solid was collected by centrifugation . Subsequently, the resulting solid was washed with MeOH several to isolate Pd(0)@TC -R-A after overnight drying in vacuum.

Theattachment ofPdNPswiththecagecompound wasfurtherjustifiedbyN2gassorptionexperiments at77K.Theestimated surfaceareaofthecageTC-RandthehybridmaterialPd(0)@TC-R-A werefoundtobe94.4m2/gand28.4m2/g,respectively (FigureS25).Hence,itcanbeassumedthatthelossofpermanent porosityofcageTC-Rduetotheoccupancy ofPdNPsintheinter-molecular space.Finally,theXPSanalysisofPd(0)@TC-R-A exhibited twopeaksat340.6eVand335.3eVwhicharesignatures ofthePd(0)oxidation state(Figure5d).

Face-Directed Tetrahedral OrganicCageAnchoredPalladium Nanoparticles forSelective HomocouplingReactionsPallabBhandari,[a]Bijnaneswar Mondal,[b]ProdipHowlader,[a]andParthaSarathiMukherjee*[a]Numerous metalla-supramolecular architectures havebeendesigned usingcoordination-driven self-assembly, whilethenumberofanalogous organicarchitectures isstillverylimited.
